message: Surprised I haven't gotten a response to this on stack overflow yet; basically %p should give you an uppercase AM/PM, which works correctly using strftime, but doesn't work using a localization format.
In the active support default there's this:
Might be a bug in i18n, or you might have to actually "define" what am/pm are in the en localization...i'm sort of assuming some localizations don't use am/pm....

There's no differentiation between %p %P as there is in strftime.  I over-rode am and pm to uppercase in my en.yml file and am now getting the expected output.  Personally I'd view this as a bug in localization.  Thoughts?
hmmm, that's an interesting idea.  I'm going to dig into that

time:
    formats:
      default: "%a, %d %b %Y %H:%M:%S %z"
      short: "%d %b %H:%M"
      long: "%B %d, %Y %H:%M"
    am: "am"
    pm: "pm"
